info.title: TradeLeadsAPI
info.description: The Trade Leads API provides contract opportunities for U.S. businesses selling their products and services overseas. These leads come from a variety of sources. We currently provide trade leads, procurement opportunities, and contract notifications from: The State Department’s Business Information Database System (BIDS), FedBizOps, The United Kingdom, Canada, The Millennium Challenge Corporation, Australia, and The United States Trade and Development Agency (USTDA).

get.description: The Trade Leads API provides contract opportunities for U.S. businesses selling their products and services overseas. These leads come from a variety of sources. We currently provide trade leads, procurement opportunities, and contract notifications from: The State Department’s Business Information Database System (BIDS), FedBizOps, The United Kingdom, Canada, The Millennium Challenge Corporation, Australia, and The United States Trade and Development Agency (USTDA).

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Searches for a match within the title, description, topic, tags, industry, ita_industries, and procurement_organization fields.

parameters.name: industries
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for specific controlled industry terms. This method allows you to search for multiple industries (plural) separated by commas.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for a specific country based on ISO alpha-2 country codes. This method allows you to search for multiple countries (plural) separated by commas but will only return one country (singular) per lead.

parameters.name: trade_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for a specific Trade Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: world_regions
parameters.description: Returns trade leads for a specific World Region.  Enter multiple values by separating with a comma.

parameters.name: sources
parameters.description: Searches only the leads specified by the Source field.

parameters.name: publish_date
parameters.description: Returns leads based on their publish date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns leads based on their end date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: publish_date_amended
parameters.description: Returns leads based on their amended publish date. Dates are filtered by comparing them against an inclusive range, which must be entered with the following format YYYY-mm-dd TO YYYY-mm-dd. Searching on a single date can be done by entering the same value for the start and end of the range.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The size parameter allows you to configure the number of results to be returned up to a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset parameter defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Unless specified the API returns 10 results at a time.

country.description: Country where the procurement opportunity is taking place.

lodgement_address.description: Email address or directions for contacting the lead.

phone.description: Phone number for contacting the lead.

multi_agency_access.description: Whether or not multiple agencies are permitted to contact this trade lead.

delivery_timeframe.description: The timeframe during which the opportunity exists.

contact_officer.description: The officer to contact about the opportunity.

email.description: The email address of the contact officer.

other_instructions.description: Additional instructions for this trade lead.

app_reference.description: Reference id of the application from the source.

click_url.description: URL that pertains to the trade lead.

panel_arrangement.description: Whether or not a panel arrangement is in place.

conditions_for_participation.description: The conditions for participating in the bid.

publish_date_amended.description: Amended publish date for the lead.

status.description: Status of the lead (note this API only shows open leads).

industry.description: Industry categories assigned to the opportunity.

source_industry.description: Industry term associated with the lead by the source agency.

project_size.description: Budget for project in U.S. dollars.

min_contract_value.description: Minimum value of the lead (in U.K. pounds).

max_contract_value.description: Maximum value of the lead (in U.K. pounds).

trade_agreement.description: Relevant trade agreement for the contract.

non_competitive_procurement_strategy.description: States whether it is a competitive procurement.

urls.description: URLs that pertain to the bid.

source.description: Entity providing the trade lead information.

lead_source.description: Source of the trade lead, typically an organization.

categories.description: Array of categories that describe the procurement opportunity.

parent_id.description: Procurement opportunity that this lead is related to.

procurement_method.description: Describes who may respond to the lead.

topic.description: Short description of the category that the lead falls under

url.description: URL that pertains to the bid.

trade_region.description: The trade regions associated with the lead.

world_region.description: The world regions associated with the lead.
